alert.note: Alert for Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:53PM EST until January 10 at 3:44AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs affecting Cobb County. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Powder Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and the natural flood plain upstream and downstream from the gage at Powder Springs Road. A walkway parallel to the creek on the right bank will be under 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EST Tuesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 09/17/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM EST.
